intro: Randia aristeguietae, commonly known as the Ecuadorian randia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at moderate elevations. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
